senses.sense_definition: The land along the edge of the sea.

examples.text: We could see the rocky <w>sealine</w> from the deck of the ship.
The fog completely obscured the distant <w>sealine</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The apparent line where the sea meets the sky.

examples.text: The sun dipped below the <w>sealine</w>, painting the sky red.
A lone ship appeared on the <w>sealine</w> just before dusk.

senses.sense_definition: An underwater pipeline used to transport oil or gas.

examples.text: Engineers inspected the <w>sealine</w> for any signs of a leak.
The construction of the new gas <w>sealine</w> will begin next month.

senses.sense_definition: A weighted rope used to measure the depth of water.

examples.text: The sailor dropped the <w>sealine</w> to check the depth of the channel.
They needed a longer <w>sealine</w> to reach the bottom of the bay.

senses.sense_definition: A strong line used for fishing in deep ocean waters.

examples.text: He cast his heavy <w>sealine</w> into the dark waves.
The fisherman repaired the tangled <w>sealine</w> on the deck.
